Question: Which of the following is the design for securing safety and reliability known as “foolproof”?

Choices.a: A redundant configuration, such as duplication, can be used so that even when a device failure occurs, the functions of the overall system are not affected.
Choices.b: Even when the user performs an incorrect operation, a problem does not occur in the system.
Choices.c: When a device failure occurs, damage can be minimized by enabling the system to stop safely.
Choices.d: When a device failure occurs, the system runs even if the usable functions are restricted, and the processing efficiency is reduced.

Question: There is a system where the operating status is continuously monitored. Which of the following work items is applicable in selecting work items in capacity planning that is conducted when a new job is added to the system after several years of operation?
